physical_appearance:This is a letter. The letter is printed in black ink on a plain sheet of paper. The letterhead is printed at the top
 with a circular logo of the Colonial Secretary
 Straits Settlement printed at the top. The date is printed at the top-right corner. There is a blue stamp with red inscriptions at the top-right corner. The letter is printed in a small paragraph at the right hand side of the paper. The signature is printed at the bottom-left corner. The document has several tears and folds around the edges especially along the top-right and borrom-left corners.
subject_terms_1:world wars prisoners of war documents (object genre) petitions
subject_terms_2:World War
 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Letters Petitions
subject_terms_3:war personalities Letters
subject_terms_4:
sgcool_label_text:Loose papers from the James Steele
 P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing
 Japanese banana money
 map of camp
 administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment
 list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.title_text: Miscellaneous scraps of paper from P.O.W James Steele Archives (30 pieces) P.O.W. James Steele Archives: Letter of acknowledgement from Colonial Secretary
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a letter. The letter is printed in black ink on a plain sheet of paper. The letterhead is printed at the top, with a circular logo of the Colonial Secretary, Straits Settlement printed at the top. The date is printed at the top-right corner. There is a blue stamp with red inscriptions at the top-right corner. The letter is printed in a small paragraph at the right hand side of the paper. The signature is printed at the bottom-left corner. The document has several tears and folds around the edges especially along the top-right and borrom-left corners.
metadata.subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war documents (object genre) petitions
metadata.subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Letters Petitions
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele, P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing, Japanese banana money, map of camp, administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment, list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
